text: On November 5, 2021, people were crushed by a large crowd of concertgoers during the first night of the Astroworld Festival, in Houston, Texas, United States. It was a music event hosted by Travis Scott. Eight people were killed in the crush on that night. The cause of death still under investigation. Twenty-three were hospitalized and more than 300 people were treated for injuries at the festival's field hospital. On November 10, another person died from their injuries. ==References== Category:2021 disasters in the United States Category:2021 in Texas Category:21st century in Houston Category:Disasters in Texas Category:November 2021 events
title: Astroworld Festival crowd crush
